Event: Living in a state of depression and mental illness for several years, pushing away friends and creating a reputation for oneself, experiencing negative emotions and lacking positive ones, feeling stuck and unable to pretend to be happy.
Post:
"I've been struggling with depression and mental illness for years, and it's made me push away the people closest to me. I've created a reputation for myself as someone who is always negative and unhappy. I can't help but feel stuck in this rut, and even pretending to be happy feels like a chore."

Event: Recognizing the need for help with depression and anxiety, considering antidepressants as a potential solution after previous trial with Lexapro yielding no noticeable change.
Post: "I've been struggling with depression and anxiety for a while now, and I'm finally considering seeking help. I've tried Lexapro before, but it didn't seem to make a difference. Maybe it's time to explore other options, like antidepressants. Wish me luck! #mentalhealth #anxiety #depression"

Event: Severe depression and anxiety issues, difficulty finding and keeping a job, feeling over-qualified and undervalued in the job market, struggling to afford basic needs such as housing and food, feeling isolated and alone with few close friends or support systems.
Post: "I'm always struggling to find a job that pays enough to cover my basic needs, and it's making me feel like a failure. I have severe depression and anxiety issues that make it hard for me to even get out of bed in the morning. I feel over-qualified and undervalued in the job market, and it's isolating me from my friends and family. It's hard to afford housing and food, let alone enjoy life's luxuries. I'm constantly worried about my future and feel like I'm stuck in a rut with no way out."

The main event in the text is the individual's struggle with their living situation, including their lack of friends and negative relationships with some people in their home town. The event is unambiguously bad from the individual's point of view, as they are experiencing difficulties and feeling unhappy with their current circumstances. The event occurs in the present and hypothetical future (i.e., the possibility of moving away), and it has a significant impact on the individual's life and well-being.
Post: "I'm so sick of living in this small town where everyone knows everyone's business. I can't even go to the grocery store without running into someone who's going to judge me for my clothes or my hair. And don't even get me started on the people I work with, they're all so fake and two-faced. I'm just ready to pack up and leave this place behind, but I know I'll never be able to afford it. I'm stuck here, living in this hellhole for the rest of my life. #SAS"

Event: Talking about feelings and depression, particularly the way guys vs girls handle it.
Post:
"I'm always feeling down, like I'm stuck in a rut that I can't escape. No matter what I do, I just can't seem to shake off this darkness. It's like it's a part of me, a constant companion that I can't ever get rid of. And the worst part is, I don't even know why I feel this way. It's like there's this voice in my head that's always telling me that I'm not good enough, that I'll never be good enough. It's exhausting, and sometimes I just want to give up. But I can't, because I have to keep going for my family, for my friends, for myself. So I put on a fake smile and pretend like everything is okay, even though it's not. And that's the hardest part of all - feeling like I'm living a lie, like I'm trapped in this never-ending cycle of sadness and despair. But I know I can't give up, no matter how hard it gets. I have to keep fighting, for myself and for those who care about me."

SAS Attribution: "I'm always feeling down because I have a natural tendency towards negativity. It's just who I am as a person - a pessimist at heart. And honestly, it's not something that I can change or control. It's like my brain is wired to see the worst in every situation, and no matter how hard I try, I can't seem to shake off this negative mindset. So even when good things happen, I still feel down because deep down, I don't believe that it'll last. It's like I'm programmed to expect the worst, and that's just a part of who I am."

Post: "I'm constantly pressured to conform to societal norms, even though I know I'm meant to stand out."

Fluent and general expression: The narrator's experience of feeling ignored and disrespected by his classmates when he tries to help clean up their messy classroom is a significant event that highlights the importance of appreciating and valuing the efforts of others, especially in a community or group setting.

I end up sweeping the room myself, feeling hurt and frustrated. It's like, don't they know that a little bit of gratitude goes a long way? #SAS"

Event: An individual (the narrator) experiences a series of events, including meeting Annie in 5th grade, attending a camp together where they did not make new friends or know each other better, starting to like Annie, and then being separated from her by their teacher. The narrator's emotions range from boredom and introversion to happiness and love, but are ultimately impacted by the separation from Annie.
Post: "I've always been a bit of a loner, but when I met Annie in 5th grade, everything changed. We clicked immediately, and I finally felt like I had someone who understood me. But then we went to camp together, and things took a turn for the worse. We didn't make any new friends, and we barely knew each other better. Despite that, my feelings for Annie only grew stronger. But just when I thought things were finally falling into place, our teacher separated us. Now I'm left feeling confused and hurt. I guess some people are just meant to be alone."

Event: The individual is feeling sad and worried that others may think they are not safe, leading to panic and fear of being sent to a facility for treatment.

"I'm so afraid that people will think I'm not safe and send me away for treatment. I can't help but feel sad and worried about this possibility."

This post attributes the individual's feelings of sadness and worry to their perceived lack of safety and the potential for being sent away for treatment. It implies that the individual believes they are inherently unsafe and that others may view them as a danger, leading to their fear and panic. This attributional style reinforces the idea that the individual's negative emotions are caused by their perceived inadequacy and vulnerability.

Anyone else feeling lost and alone in this messed up world? #sadness #depression #overwhelmed"
